content: The "Health Insurance Affordability and Equity Act of 1999" is introduced, which includes a credit for health insurance costs of previously uninsured individuals and individuals with COBRA coverage. This new section, SEC. 25B, addresses the health insurance costs for these specific groups. The Health Insurance Affordability and Equity Act of 1999 introduces a tax credit for individuals who pay for qualified health insurance coverage for themselves, their spouse, and dependents. The credit is equal to 60% of the amount paid during the taxable year, with monthly limitations based on the type of coverage. The credit is equal to 60% of the amount paid during the taxable year, with monthly limitations based on the type of coverage. Eligible months are defined as those starting at least 1 year after the individual's last participation in a group health plan providing qualified health insurance.
